title: Grits for the Ribs: True-life Stories and Selected Poems
description: IllustratedColor "Grits for the Ribs" is uplifting, remarkable and revealing . . . memoir style and poetry. This book casts light on a certain enigmatic South during a pivotal era of history in the United States. One family effects change, while in pursuit of former President Franklin Delano Rooseveltâ€™s promise of a New Deal. There are also heartwarming real-life stories about phenomenal folk, with irrepressible grit and resiliency of spirit, as well as testimony and poetry. This is a special book. We must all determine our good futures, and forge it as well, whatever obstacles life brings. "Grits for the Ribs" is sprinkled throughout with dreams and Wonder Bread, from fishing at La Push to throwing bumble bee bombs on Brother. It will illuminate, intrigue, hearten and, above all, fuel the imagination of everyone who reads it. Feel free to invite friends, ample helpings are available. These grits nourish the soul.
author: Janet  Anderson
